title.narrative: Inclusive Peace and Transition Initiative: Impact Local Peace Project 2017-2019
Initiativet för inkluderande freds - och transitionsprocesser (IPTI) 2017-2019

description.narrative: Inclusive Peace and Transition Initiative (IPTI) planerar att implementera ett pilotprojekt som syftar till att stärka relevansen och effektiviteten av civilsamhällesorganisationers fredsbyggnadsarbete. Baserat på den forskning som bedrivits vid Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies av bland annat Dr. Thania Paffenholz om civil samhällets roll i fredsbyggande vill IPTI stödja lokala fredbyggnadsorganisationer att förstärka sina metoder och arbetssätt. Projektet är en delvis ny riktning för organisationen vilket gör att det kan betraktas som ett pilotprojekt och kommer därför att implementeras i olika faser för att säkerställa att inriktningen hamnar rätt. Projektet har en budget på 4 990 000 SEK och kommer implementeras under perioden 1 oktober 2017 till 30 april 2019.

The Inclusive Peace and Transition Initiative (IPTI) plans to implement a pilot project aimed at strengthening the relevance and effectiveness of civil society organizations peacebuilding work. Based on the research conducted at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies (of which IPTI is an integral part) by Dr. Thania Paffenholz and others on the role of civil society in peacebuilding, IPTI wants to support local peacebuilding organizations to strengthen their methods and practices. The project is a pilot project since it is a partially new direction for the organization. The project will therefore be implemented in different phases to ensure that the direction of the project is finetuned during the implementation. The project has a budget of 4,990,000 SEK and will be implemented during the period 1 October 2017 to 30 April 2019.

The objective of the project is to support local civil society organizations (CSOs) to make their peacebuilding projects more relevant and effective. The purpose of the project is to make local civil society actors profit from IPTI’s knowledge base and merge it with their own local experiences and knowledge through a joint process of developing an open access platform of practical tools for local CSOs and their international partners.

participating-org.narrative: Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies, Geneva
University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Impact Local Peace (ILP) project was implemented Inlcusice Peace and Transition Initative (IPTI) between December 2017 and August 2019. The project included global consultations, mapping of existing tools, platforms and actors on the subject, and field assessments and pilot initiatives in Colombia and Ukraine (and to a lesser extent in Myanmar and Libya). Examples of results achieved: - In Colombia, following bilateral meetings with key Colombian organisations and networks, a group of six Colombian organisations from diverse background came together and formed the core group for the project. The group eventually led the process in Colombia, holding meetings both with and without IPTI staff for joint reflection discussion concerning the themes of the project. As these groups frequently lacked previous contacts with one another, the very composition of this group and the members’ engagement in instances of joint reflection represents a concrete result. This was emphasised by the evaluation. - The results of ILP’s involvement in Ukraine led to the mapping of civil society’s role in peacebuilding and the launching of discussions in this regard both with Ukrainian NGOs and international actors present in the country. - The activities together served to unpack conceptual questions and identified key trends from experiences by civil society practitioners in peacebuilding, which in turn fed into the development and launch of the open-access online platform containing a few resource materials. This website will require further development though.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
